snippet: In 2011, the Justice Department proposed an expansion of the background-check system, but it remains unclear whether the Obama administration will take on the powerful gun-rights lobby.
abstract: Proposal drawn up by Justice Department in 2011 to expand background-check system for buying guns was shelved as election campaign heated up; plan could provide blueprint for Obama administration should it choose to take aggressive steps to curb gun violence in wake of Newtown, Conn, shooting; proposal contains several measures that Pres Obama could enact by executive order if Congress refuses to act.
lead_paragraph: In 2011, the Justice Department proposed an expansion of the background-check system, but it remains unclear whether the Obama administration will take on the powerful gun-rights lobby.

headline.main: Justice Dept. Shelved Ideas to Improve Gun Background Checks
headline.print_headline: Justice Dept. Shelved Ideas to Improve Gun Background Checks
